div.bibl: Svenska Kuriren, May 31, 1928FRED LUNDIN, "the poor Swede",

body.p: has no use for Herbert Hoover as a presidential canditate on the Republican ticket. He said so in no roundabout way in a speech that he delivered at a banquet the other day at Palmer House in honor of William J. Stratton, the Republican candidate for the office of Secretary of State of Illinois.

"If the Kansas City conversion should fail to nominate ex-Governor Lowden, the choice of State of Illinois, then the delegates must necessarily unite in the nomination of another man, who will have the support of the whole nation - Senator Charles S. Deneen", said Mr. Lundin, and added: "Hoover, the Wilsonian Democrat, is the only and real danger for a Republican victory in Illinois".
